title: Integrate Existing Helpers View into Beta
body:
- [ ] Create React Implementation of [helpers](https://www.mycrypto.com/helpers.html); integrate into beta

https://beta.mycrypto.com/helpers.html leads to a blank page.

In the footer there is a link to the helpers page, but it leads to the MyCrypto production version's helpers page and when you navigate off that, you end up on the prod. version of MyCrypto.

__This issue now has a funding of 0.25 ETH (135.28 USD @ $541.12/ETH) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can claim it [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/MyCryptoHQ/MyCrypto/1117). * If you've completed this issue and want to claim the bounty you can do so [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/MyCryptoHQ/MyCrypto/1117) * Questions? Get help on the Gitcoin Slack * $3379.55 more Funded OSS Work Available at: https://gitcoin.co/explorer
I can get going on this right away! Will let you know if I have any questions once I get setup.

Sorry for the delay. With the above issue closed I'll get going on this again tomorrow night and will have it wrapped by the end of the weekend.

Cheers!
@tommycox Hey! Thanks for jumping on this issue. How are things progressing?

@dternyak Hey! I got held up over the weekend with some other work but have this evening and tomorrow evening blocked out to work on this. I'll open a PR tonight to track the work once I get some pen to paper. If I can't wrap it up in that time, I'd be happy to hand it over.
I have some tasks piling up so I'm gonna toss this back out there until I get some extra cycles. If it's still around in a couple days I'd love to come back to it then.

Hey @ss1187

Thanks for picking up this task. How are things going so far on implementation? Any confusion about the scope of the task?

i'm so sorry. i found myself super busy during the week of spring break and am finally able to get back to some ME time. although, my me time still involves me working, lol. anywho, i am just a little but confused on this task. not necessarily on what needs to be done but well, here's what i noticed: so here is the blank page on the left. and to the right is the code. now, here's the page as it should look and as you want to open: and to the right, the code. but notice under the network tab, under beta.mycrypto.com, the working page includes common/assets/images, as well as the 3 images under client.df9e730b.css, versus the blank page that does not include these. i am new to coding. i get it but i dont get it, but i'm trying to pick it up. i'm not sure where to go next with this information but i am hoping that it in some way helps. let me know what i can do.

Hey @ss1187, I appreciate you trying to take this on but I think this task might be too much for someone new to coding to complete in the near future. Would you mind opening this task back up on GitCoin to allow someone else to take a crack at it?

What you're looking at in the screenshots is HTML, which isn't really what we'd consider "the code" of the app. The majority of the app's logic and functionality is done in Typescript (a dialect of Javascript,) using the React library. I'd suggest you look up some tutorials on how to write React code before trying to dive into the MyCrypto codebase.
Awesome, perfect timing. I have some extra cycles again and some React/Angular (since that's what we're converting from) chops as well! Looking forward to getting back to this.
@tommycox Good to see you hopping on this one!
@tommycox Great! We're aiming for a code freeze this Friday for our production release candidate, as a heads up. How's progress so far? Any issues?

@dternyak I promise to get going on this tonight. Would you mind providing a 10,000 foot overview of expected deliverables as far as components and any existing functions or styling that should be leveraged?

@tommycox This task is to integrate the helpers view you see [here](https://www.mycrypto.com/helpers.html) into our beta codebase. 

The deliverable will be a PR that includes components necessary for the helpers and adjusts to the router, navbar, and other as needed to integrate this view.

@dternyak Sorry for holding this up. I've familiarized myself with the two codebases and am still invested in this but am visiting a family member in the hospital and am somewhat pre-occupied. I'm gonna toss this back in case someone else can get to it before the code freeze. I can provide insight into the two codebases if the next contributor is interested; have a conceptual solution of the components in mind. May be able to get back around to implementation but don't want to stake any claim that'd prevent this feature from fruition.
@dternyak Would you want this linked from the Navbar, or from the existing location in the footer?

Either work, but we can keep it in the footer for simplicity.

@tommycox Sorry to hear. Best of luck with the family situation.
@dternyak I caught up on the story, "Convert Ethererum Units" section and the ""SHA3" (Keccak-256) It!" section are things I can try to make a pull request for today

Hey @oojr, looking forward to seeing the work. As a request, when converting over to our new styles, I just had a couple of asks for the design / implementation: * Each "helper" should be its own component that's fairly self contained * I think it would look great if each helper was its own subtab (using our SubTabs.tsx component) * Each subtab should have its own route, e.g. `/helpers/ens-debugger` * Helpers shouldn't be in the nav, but instead be accessed by the link in the footer If there are any helpers you don't think you can pull off, just let us know, we can help out. Thanks!
@oojr are you still working on this issue?
@gitcoinbot yes I am, @wbobeirne I just saw that you wanted me to implement Subtabs, I will try to add that in
@oojr are you still working on this issue?

@oojr are you still working on this issue?

@oojr Hey - I just wanted to confirm that you're no longer interested in working on this. It looked like you were making steady (if a bit slow) progress so far, but I also saw you left a comment that went unanswered by myself. 

It looks like @domalak has now claimed the task, so I just wanted to touch-base and make sure all of this is kosher, and if not, how we can fix things up. 

--

Thanks for you interest @domalak! I'm hoping we can transition this bounty smoothly, and look forward to working together on solving this issue!
